gameplay
Class Game

java.lang.Object
  gameplay.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
logging.Loggable
public final class Game
extends java.lang.Object
implements logging.Loggable

Overview

Game is the main class of the gameplay package.
It manages all the actions made by dinosaurs and the game loop. The game proceed by turns owned by the players in game. During a turn only the turn owner can make actions while the other players keep on waiting for their turn.
This class also handles the creation and removal of dinosaurs and players in game. It also returns all the information regardind dinosaurs and It stores this informations:

  • The curent player index
  • The current turn number
  • The list of in game players
  • The state of the game
  • Its unique istance
  • A map containing the turn listeners
  • The timer to start the game
  • The turn confirmation timer
  • The turn execution timer

Responsibilities

The Game class is responsible for the addition of players in the current game.
It handles the turns.
It manages all the dinosaurs' actions

Collaborators

Map, Species, Player, DinosaurIDManager, GameState

Version:
1.0
Author:
AXXO

addDinosaur

public Dinosaur addDinosaur(Player thePlayer)
                     throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                            exceptions.SpeciesIsFullException
The method addDinosaur adds a dinosaur to the player given as parameter. It calls #registerDinosaurInGame(Dinosaur) to register the new dinosaur and Map#placeDinosaurRandomly(Dinosaur) to assigns a random position to it

Parameters:
thePlayer - the player to which the new dinosaur will be added
Returns:
the newly created dinosaur
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the player given as parameter is null or if its species its null
exceptions.SpeciesIsFullException - if the species owned by the player given as parameter is full
See Also:
Species, Map

registerDinosaurInGame

private void registerDinosaurInGame(Dinosaur theDinosaur)
The method registerDinosaurInGame is intended to register a new fresh dinosaur or the existing dinosaur of a player when the server is resumed without using the addDinosaur method (that creates a fresh new dinosaur instead);

Parameters:
theDinosaur - to be registered
See Also:
DinosaurIDManager

growDinosaur

public void growDinosaur(Dinosaur theDinosaur)
                  throws exceptions.InvalidDinosaurIDException,
                         exceptions.MaxSizeReachedException,
                         exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException,
                         exceptions.TurnNotOwnedByPlayerException,
                         exceptions.MaxMovesLimitException,
                         exceptions.StarvationDeathException
The method growDinosaur check if the dinosaur given as parameter is able to grow, in that case it performs all the required instructions:
It increases its size, updates its energy and sets that it is not able to grow anymore in this turn

Parameters:
theDinosaur - the dinosaur wanting to grow up
Throws:
exceptions.InvalidDinosaurIDException - if the dinosaur ID of the dinosaur given as parameter is not valid
exceptions.MaxSizeReachedException - if the dinosaur already reached its maximum size
exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException - if the player owning the dinosaur is not in game
exceptions.TurnNotOwnedByPlayerException - if the player does not own the current turn
exceptions.MaxMovesLimitException - if the dinosaur has alreeady grown up in this turn
exceptions.StarvationDeathException - if the dinosaur has not enough energy to perform the grow
See Also:
DinosaurIDManager, Dinosaur

layEgg

public beans.NewBornID layEgg(Dinosaur theDinosaur)
                       throws exceptions.SpeciesIsFullException,
                              exceptions.MaxMovesLimitException,
                              exceptions.IdentifierNotPresentException,
                              exceptions.TurnNotOwnedByPlayerException,
                              exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException,
                              exceptions.StarvationDeathException
The method layEgg check if the dinosaur given as parameter is able to lay an egg, in that case it creates a new born dinosaur and call #registerDinosaurInGame(Dinosaur)) to register it and Map#placeDinosaurRandomly(Dinosaur, Dinosaur) to place it near the parent dinosaur

Parameters:
theDinosaur - the parent dinosaur
Returns:
the dinosaur ID of the new born dinosaur
Throws:
exceptions.SpeciesIsFullException - if the species of the player owning the dinosaur given as parameter is full
exceptions.MaxMovesLimitException - if the dinosaur already laid an egg or grew up in this turn
exceptions.IdentifierNotPresentException - if the dinosaur is null or if its identifier is not valid
exceptions.TurnNotOwnedByPlayerException - if the player owning the dinosaur does not own the current turn
exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException - if the player owning the dinosaur is not in game
exceptions.StarvationDeathException - if the dinosaur has not enough energy to perform the action
See Also:
DinosaurIDManager, Map, Species

moveDinosaur

public void moveDinosaur(Dinosaur theDinosaur,
                         util.Position theDestination)
                  throws exceptions.IdentifierNotPresentException,
                         exceptions.StarvationDeathException,
                         exceptions.InvalidDestinationException,
                         exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException,
                         exceptions.TurnNotOwnedByPlayerException,
                         exceptions.MaxMovesLimitException,
                         exceptions.FightLostException,
                         exceptions.FightWonException
The method moveDinosaur check if the dinosaur is able to move in this turn then calls Map#moveDinosaur(Dinosaur, Position) which delegates to the Map class the task of checking the movement path
If the dinosaur encounters a fight it calls #manageFight(Dinosaur, Dinosaur) to get the result of the fight

Parameters:
theDinosaur - the dinosaur to be moved
theDestination - the position the dinosaur is going to be placed
Throws:
exceptions.IdentifierNotPresentException - if the dinosaur given as parameter is null or if its identifier is null
exceptions.StarvationDeathException - if the dinosaur has not enough energy to move
exceptions.InvalidDestinationException - if the destination is not valid
exceptions.PlayerNotInGameException - if the player owning the dinosaur is not in game
exceptions.TurnNotOwnedByPlayerException - if the player owning the dinosaur does not own the current turn
exceptions.MaxMovesLimitException - if the dinosaur already moved in this turn
exceptions.FightLostException - if the dinosaur lost the fight
exceptions.FightWonException - if the dinosaur won the fight
See Also:
Map, DinosaurIDManager

addPlayer

public void addPlayer(Player thePlayer)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      exceptions.PlayerAlreadyInGameException,
                      exceptions.SpeciesNotCreatedException,
                      exceptions.MaxInGamePlayersExceededException
The method addPlayer adds a player to the game. It first call #canAddPlayer(Player) to check if that is possible
If it is his/her first turn ever with the current species a new dinosaur is added else it registers its dinosaurs to the game

Parameters:
thePlayer - to be added
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the player given as parameter is null
exceptions.PlayerAlreadyInGameException - if the player is already in game
exceptions.SpeciesNotCreatedException - if the player has not created a species yet
exceptions.MaxInGamePlayersExceededException - if the game is full
See Also:
Map

                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         exceptions.PlayerAlreadyInGameException,
                         exceptions.SpeciesNotCreatedException,
                         exceptions.MaxInGamePlayersExceededException
The method canAddPlayer is a utility method which checks if the player given as parameter can be added to the game

Parameters:
thePlayer - who can be added
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the player given as parameter is null
exceptions.PlayerAlreadyInGameException - if the player is already in game
exceptions.SpeciesNotCreatedException - if the player has not created a species yet
exceptions.MaxInGamePlayersExceededException - if the game is full

java.lang.NullPointerException - if the dinosaur given as parameter is null

              throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,

performTurnCalculations

private void performTurnCalculations(Player thePlayer)
                              throws exceptions.MaxSpeciesAgeExceededException
The method performTurnCalculations manages the actions to make at the end if the turn of a player.
It checks if dinosaurs have died during the turn, updates the food present in the map and calculate the score

Parameters:
thePlayer - who finished the turn
Throws:
exceptions.MaxSpeciesAgeExceededException - if the species reached 120 turns

swapCurrentPlayer

private void swapCurrentPlayer()
The method swapCurrentPlayer gives the turn to the next player and performs turn calculations on the previous player by calling #performTurnCalculations(Player)

setPlayerGameEnd

private void setPlayerGameEnd(Player thePlayer)
The method setPlayerGameEnd is called if the species owned by a player is extinct. It removes the player from the game and delete its current species

Parameters:
thePlayer - owning the extinct species

updateAllFood

private void updateAllFood()
The method updateAllFood updates the energy of all the food present in the map and place the new carrions
